pageContext.claim: “There is no political necessity to keep Canada in the new NAFTA deal. If we don’t make a fair deal for the U.S. after decades of abuse, Canada will be out. Congress should not interfere w/ these negotiations or I will simply terminate NAFTA entirely & we will be far better off... ....Remember, NAFTA was one of the WORST Trade Deals ever made. The U.S. lost thousands of businesses and millions of jobs. We were far better off before NAFTA - should never have been signed. Even the Vat Tax was not accounted for. We make new deal or go back to pre-NAFTA!”
pageContext.analysis: The president needs congressional approval to end NAFTA and strike a new deal; he can't do it alone. Trump exaggerates the effects of NAFTA. The Congressional Research Service says the trade deal had a “modest” effect on the U.S. economy. Trump also seems to be referencing Mexico's 16 percent VAT tax. Mexican companies are subject to the tax, just as U.S. companies are. Therefore, experts say, it's not a trade barrier.
